sub_topic: De Rham cohomology and its applications
message_1: Let $M$ be a closed, orientable two-dimensional surface. Calculate the first de Rham cohomology group $H^1_{dR}(M)$ of $M$.
message_2:
To compute the first de Rham cohomology group $H^1_{dR}(M)$ of a closed, orientable two-dimensional surface $M$, we can use the fact that the de Rham cohomology groups are isomorphic to the singular cohomology groups with real coefficients. That is,

$$H^1_{dR}(M) \cong H^1(M; \mathbb{R}).$$

Now, let's consider the classification of closed, orientable two-dimensional surfaces. They are classified by their genus $g$, and can be described as connected sums of $g$ tori. That is, for a surface $M$ of genus $g$, we have

$$M \cong T^2 \# T^2 \# \cdots \# T^2 \quad (g \text{ times}),$$

where $T^2$ denotes the torus and $\#$ denotes the connected sum operation.

The first singular cohomology group of the torus $T^2$ is given by

$$H^1(T^2; \mathbb{R}) \cong \mathbb{R} \oplus \mathbb{R}.$$

Now, we can use the fact that the first singular cohomology group behaves well with respect to connected sums. Specifically, we have

$$H^1(M; \mathbb{R}) \cong H^1(T^2; \mathbb{R}) \oplus H^1(T^2; \mathbb{R}) \oplus \cdots \oplus H^1(T^2; \mathbb{R}) \quad (g \text{ times}).$$

Thus, we get

$$H^1_{dR}(M) \cong \mathbb{R} \oplus \mathbb{R} \oplus \cdots \oplus \mathbb{R} \oplus \mathbb{R} \oplus \cdots \oplus \mathbb{R} \quad (2g \text{ times}).$$

In other words, the first de Rham cohomology group of a closed, orientable two-dimensional surface of genus $g$ is a direct sum of $2g$ copies of the real numbers:

$$H^1_{dR}(M) \cong \mathbb{R}^{2g}.$$
